translated: New Compilation of a Comprehensive Catalog of Buddhist Scriptures, Scroll 1

Zhi Tong's Record of Questions and Answers on the One Vehicle in two fascicles, the monk's biography says that the chapter on Dao Shen is
Dao Shen's Record. According to the biography of Yi Xiang in the History of Monks of the Great Song Dynasty,
it says:ğŸ”½Sometimes writing with a brush or on a sash,
carrying lead and writing on leaves,ğŸ”½copying like a collection,
recording like a record.
Such Dharma gates,
following the disciples' names,
like calling it the chapter on Dao Shen.
Sometimes named after a place,
like calling it the questions and answers of the pointed hole, and so on.
But because the compiler at that time
was not good at literary style,ğŸ”½it resulted in vulgar sentences and phrases,
mixed with local dialects. Perhaps it was the beginning of the great teaching,
focusing on following the capacity.
In the future, gentlemen,
should add polish.

1 fascicle of the first volume of the comprehensive catalog of Buddhist teachings compiled by Zhi Shi, with an explanation of the transmission of Yitian, the third part of the Orthodox Lineage of the Gate of ÅšÄkyamuni
Chronicle Part 14
Comprehensive Records Part 19
Brief History of Ancient Times Part 4 Yitian had the surname Wang.
He was the fourth son of King Wenzong Renxiao of the Goryeo Dynasty.
He renounced the world and was enfeoffed as the Imperial Preceptor for Assisting the World.
In the early years of Yuansou, he entered China to inquire about the Way.
He submitted a memorial requesting to transmit the teachings of Huayan.
The imperial decree ordered the two streets to bestow it.
Chan Master Cheng of Jingyan in the Eastern Capital.
In response to Cheng, he mentioned Qian Tang.
Because of Jingyuan, he was replaced by himself. All the temples welcomed him.
They saw him off with the etiquette for travelers.
He first arrived at Siming Prefecture.ğŸ”½He served Mingzhi.
He also served Ci Bian.
He followed the advice and received the Tiantai teachings and contemplations.
Next, he resided at Lingzhi.
He paid homage to the great wisdom Yuanzhao.ğŸ”½He received the Vinaya Piá¹­aka.ğŸ”½He followed Jinshui Jingyuan.
He inquired about the teachings of the Huayan school.
The Chan master Yuanzhao Zongben taught him the essentials of the school.
